bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to S.J. Quinn, November 22, 1952

div1.p: Hench thanks Quinn, a U.S. Customs official, for information about shipping wood from Building No.1 to the United States.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to S.J. Quinn, November 22, 1952
div1.opener:
November 22, 1952
Mr. S. J. Quinn
Deputy Collector in Charge
Bureau of Customs
Treasury Department
St. Paul 1, Minnesota
My dear Mr. Quinn:
div1.p:
I appreciate very greatly your letter of November 14 which gave me much
helpful information that I will need to bring back from Cuba some old
wood from a historical building. I do not propose to bring very much,
perhaps only as much as would fill a large hand suit case. I note
particularly what you say about having the wood inspected in Havana
for termites and having it fumigated if necessary.

May I ask your help on one more point? You mention that I will need
the services of a licensed custom house broker, presumably at the port
of New York. I should be glad to do this but I have no idea about how
to contact such a broker. To whom does one write - the Customs House
in New York, or could you give me the name of a broker?
I would appreciate your help greatly.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
